DOC.brief_title: Reduction Intrapartum Fever With Intravenous Acetaminophen
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , control , study intravenous ( IV ) acetaminophen ( OFIRMEV ) versus orally administrate acetaminophen reduction intrapartum maternal fever fetal tachycardia . Compared oral acetaminophen , intravenous acetaminophen increase bioavailability rapid onset action . IV acetaminophen use successfully management fever post-operative patient . Additionally , intravenous acetaminophen also use intrapartum set management pain.However , use intravenous acetaminophen treatment maternal temperature subsequent fetal tachycardia , yet evaluate . The study two arm randomize 1:1 ratio . A double dummy , double blind , comparator control study design utilize . After inclusion criterion satisfy , subject control arm receive oral dose 1000 mg acetaminophen intravenous placebo resemble Ofirmev . The subject experimental arm receive 1000 mg IV Ofirmev oral placebo resemble acetaminophen . Both group receive standard obstetrical care , continuous fetal monitoring , antibiotic suspect chorioamnionitis . The blinding technique eliminate provider bias .
